page.title: 11GOING TO SCHOOL
page.content: Bronte School was opened in 1965. It is a{Middle School. }You go to Bronte when you are nine years old and leave when you are thirteen. Children go to Bronte from four{First Schools;} they are Oakworth, Oldfield, Nessfield and Holycroft. Bronte has playing- fields and some tennis courts. There are two main buildings; the fourth year block is separate from the rest. Oakbank is an {Upper School.}You go there when you are thirteen. Children from Bronte, Hartington and Worth Valley Middle Schools go there. There are three sections in the School, the main block, a sixth form unit and new recreation facilities that have been open for two years. Oakbank was originally a house for the Haggas family, who owned a big mill at Ingrow. It now houses 1150 pupils and 70 teachers.
